title: Could a new toy-swap scheme help families reduce plastic waste?
text:
I have lost count of how many toys have come in and out of our lives since our children, now five and nine, were born. Some have been loved dearly, played with endlessly and then passed on. But others have sat at the back of drawers being slowly crushed into single-use plastic confetti; and with the climate emergency at the forefront of my mind, each new toy makes me feel a little sicker. In 2018, UK consumers spent £370 million on toys, and a survey by the British Heart Foundation found that, on average, children in the UK have four toys they have never played with.
